Package com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz

A collection of classes for reading and writing puzzles in the PUZ file format

See:
          Description

Class Summary
PUZCellStyle Container for the collection of attributes that describe how a single cell in a grid should be presented to the user
PUZContext A convenience context for reading elements of a PUZ image.
PUZEncryption Provides methods to encrypt and decrypt PUZ solutions
PUZExtraSection Represents an extra section of a PUZ image.
PUZPuzzle Representation of a crossword puzzle in the PUZ file format.
PUZPuzzleInputStream Serializes a PUZPuzzle object into a PUZ image as an InputStream.
PUZPuzzleOutputStream Provides an OutputStream for deserializing a PUZ image into a PUZPuzzle object.
PUZSolution Contains the complete solution for a single cell in a PUZ puzzle.
PUZUtil A collection of utility methods and constants for reading and writing PUZ images in byte[] format
 

Package com.epeterso2.jabberwordy.serialization.puz Description

A collection of classes for reading and writing puzzles in the PUZ file format

PUZ is a file format used by the majority of crossword puzzle constructing and solving applications as well as by most popular editors and publishers. The format is both compact and binary, a decision that trades ease-of-readability for small size. The format is not formally documented, but an unofficial reverse-engineered version of the PUZ specification is available from the PUZ project on Google Code.

  • The PUZPuzzleOutputStream is used to convert a byte[] representation of a PUZ file into a PUZPuzzle object.
  • The PUZPuzzleInputStream is used to convert a PUZPuzzle object into a byte[] representation of a PUZ file.
